main_definition: On is a preposition used to indicate position or location, as well as time when something occurs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicating contact with a surface or being in physical contact with it.
meanings_and_examples.example: The book is on the table.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicating a position above something, typically supported by it.
meanings_and_examples.example: Leaves are hanging on the branches of trees.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to indicate time when an event takes place or is in progress.
meanings_and_examples.example: The concert starts at 8 p.m., so be sure to arrive on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicating that something is included within a certain scope, such as conditions or requirements.
meanings_and_examples.example: You need to have the software on your computer to use it properly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in expressions of distance from one point to another.
meanings_and_examples.example: The park is two miles on from here, so we'll walk there together.
